column4: hey I have file in my trash that says I don't have permissions to delete. Any help?
the trash is a hidden file in your home directory
you need to browse to your /home folder
sudo nautilus will show you the root trash
there is no hidden .trash file
browse to /home/your_user and then press ctrl+h
you can also go through the view menu "show hidden files" , it should be called ".trash"
I did that and there is no .trash file
do ypu s
sorry
do you see other hiden files then?
you are using Hardy?
ok in that case its in a different directory
look for .local
in local there is a "share " folder, trash should be there
Check.
Now how do I get rid of it?
or sudo and then delete it there?
if you are running sudo nautilus you should be able to delete any file in the trash
Dude, you are the mack daddy pimp! Thanks for the help. That trash was driving me crazy!
np
